ranges.notes: New Year's Day (Jan 1) is a public holiday. Most businesses, shops, and restaurants are closed or operate with limited hours. Düsseldorf is quiet as residents recover from New Year's Eve celebrations along the Rhine.

Epiphany (Jan 6) marks the official end of the Christmas season. While not a public holiday in North Rhine-Westphalia, many Christmas decorations remain up until this date, and special services are held at St. Lambertus Church and other churches.

Off-season with few tourists and excellent hotel value. Cold winter weather with temperatures often below freezing. Limited daylight hours (around 8-9 hours). Winter sales begin mid-January in all shops, particularly along the Königsallee. Many museums offer special winter exhibitions. The Kunstpalast and other cultural venues provide excellent indoor experiences during this quiet season.

Winter continues with cold weather but slightly longer days than January. Düsseldorf's low tourism season continues, making it a good time for museum visits and indoor cultural activities without crowds.

Düsseldorf's Carnival celebrations typically take place in early February, with colorful parades, traditional costumes, and lively street parties throughout the city, particularly in the Altstadt. The Rosenmontag parade is the highlight, featuring elaborate floats and celebrations along the Rhine promenade.

Winter continues with gradually improving conditions. Occasional snowfall can transform Düsseldorf's modern and historic architecture into a picturesque winter wonderland. The Kunstpalast and other museums provide excellent indoor experiences during cold days.

Early spring brings gradually warming temperatures and longer days. Trees begin to bud and early spring flowers appear in Düsseldorf's parks, particularly in the Hofgarten and along the Rhine promenade. The Japanese Garden in Nordpark begins its spectacular spring display.

Spring officially begins, bringing longer days and warming temperatures. The Hofgarten and other parks start showing colorful blooms. The Rhine River's water levels typically stabilize after winter. Tourism gradually increases but still before peak season. Easter markets may appear in late March depending on when Easter falls.

Spring is in full swing with blossoming trees and flowers throughout Düsseldorf, particularly in the Hofgarten and along the Königsallee. The weather can be variable with rain showers alternating with sunny days. Easter markets and celebrations may be present in early April depending on when Easter falls.

Düsseldorf's Rhine River cruise season typically begins in mid-April, offering scenic cruises along the Rhine. Cherry blossoms and magnolias reach their peak in the Hofgarten and along the Königsallee. The beer gardens in the Altstadt begin opening for the season.
Labor Day (May 1) is a public holiday in Germany with public demonstrations, rallies, and events throughout Düsseldorf. Many businesses are closed. Outdoor festivities take place throughout the city.

May brings the internationally acclaimed Düsseldorf Jazz Rally, featuring hundreds of musicians performing across various venues in the Altstadt and MedienHafen. Perfect spring weather with comfortable temperatures makes this an ideal time to visit before summer crowds arrive. The Rhine promenades become lively with locals and visitors enjoying the riverfront.

Early summer brings warm days and pleasant evenings. Tourism increases as the outdoor season is in full swing. Outdoor dining along the Rhine promenade becomes particularly popular. The Japanese Garden in Nordpark reaches its peak spring beauty.

The open-air cinema season begins in the MedienHafen, offering evening film screenings against the backdrop of the illuminated harbor architecture. The combination of modern architecture and summer evenings creates a unique cultural experience.

The hottest month of the year with temperatures occasionally exceeding 30°C. Peak summer season with high tourism levels. 'Rhine in Flames' transforms the Rhine River into a stage for fireworks and illuminated boats. Rhine beaches and riverside activities are in full swing. The Altstadt's beer gardens and outdoor dining areas are particularly popular during warm summer evenings.

Summer festivities continue throughout August with cultural events, outdoor concerts, and activities along the Rhine. The summer heat continues with warm days and comfortable evenings. The Japanese Garden Summer Festival offers traditional cultural events and tea ceremonies. The Altstadt's beer festival brings traditional celebrations to the historic district.

Early September continues with pleasant summer-like conditions. Tourism begins to decrease slightly while weather remains beautiful. Perfect time for Rhine River excursions and visits to nearby attractions before autumn colors emerge.

The second Sunday in September is the European Heritage Day (Tag des offenen Denkmals), when normally inaccessible historical buildings, restoration workshops, and private historical homes throughout Düsseldorf open to the public with special guided tours.

Mid to late September brings the beginning of autumn colors to Düsseldorf's parks and the surrounding countryside. Excellent time to visit as summer crowds diminish while weather remains pleasant. Oktoberfest celebrations begin in various locations throughout the city. Seasonal specialties appear in restaurants featuring game, mushrooms, and regional produce.
Oktoberfest celebrations continue into early October with traditional beer tents and festivities throughout the city.

German Unity Day (Tag der Deutschen Einheit) is a nationwide public holiday commemorating German reunification in 1990. Government offices and most businesses are closed. Public celebrations and events take place throughout Düsseldorf.

Pleasant autumn weather with gradually cooling temperatures. Trees display spectacular fall colors in Düsseldorf's parks and along the Rhine. Fashion Week brings international designers and fashion events to the city. Ideal conditions for urban exploration and day trips to nearby attractions. The Japanese Garden offers special autumn viewing events.
All Saints' Day is observed in predominantly Catholic areas of North Rhine-Westphalia. Weather turns noticeably cooler with occasional fog along the Rhine.

Full autumn with cooler temperatures and shorter days. Tourism levels decrease significantly. Good time for museum visits and indoor cultural activities. Many restaurants offer seasonal autumn specialties featuring game, mushrooms, and pumpkin dishes.

St. Martin's Day (Martinstag) celebrations include children's lantern processions through the streets of Düsseldorf, particularly in residential neighborhoods. Traditional goose dinners are served at many restaurants.

Mid-November sees cooling temperatures and occasionally foggy days along the Rhine. Museum visits and indoor cultural activities become more popular. The Kunstpalast and other museums offer special exhibitions.

Late November sees the city preparing for the Christmas season. Christmas decorations appear throughout the city center, and Düsseldorf's Christmas markets prepare to open, typically during the last week of November.

Düsseldorf's Christmas Markets run from late November until December 22 or 23. The city hosts several distinct Christmas markets, with the most famous being the historic market in the Altstadt, the modern market at the MedienHafen, and the traditional market at the Marktplatz. The markets feature traditional wooden stalls selling crafts, seasonal treats, and regional specialties. The entire historic center is beautifully illuminated.

Christmas Eve (Heiligabend) is the main celebration day for most German families. Many businesses close early on December 24. The Christmas Markets are typically closed by this date. St. Lambertus Church and other churches hold special Christmas Eve services that attract many visitors.

December 25 and 26 are both public holidays in Germany. Most businesses, restaurants, and attractions are closed or operate with limited hours. A quiet time in the city as most residents celebrate with family.

The period between Christmas and New Year sees the city in a quiet mode. Many locals are on holiday, but most major museums and attractions reopen. Good time for winter sales shopping and museum visits.

New Year's Eve (Silvester) celebrations take place throughout Düsseldorf, particularly along the Rhine promenade. Many restaurants offer special dinner menus, and hotels host celebration events. Fireworks displays light up the skyline at midnight, with the modern and historic city silhouette creating a spectacular backdrop.

spring: Cherry Blossom Viewing in City Parks
summer: Rhine River Swimming and Beach Activities
winter: New Year's Eve Celebrations on the Rhine

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism (or cold winter days)
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
